DETROIT, Dec 16 (Reuters) - Amazon-backed electric vehicle startup Rivian Automotive Inc RIVN.O on Thursday said it will build a plant in Georgia, its second U.S. assembly plant, as it looks to expand production.

In its first publicly reported quarterly results since it went public last month, Rivian also reported a third-quarter loss.

The new plant will employ more than 7,500 people, is scheduled to open in 2024 and will eventually build 400,000 vehicles a year, largely confirming plans previously outlined in documents filed with other states. (Full Story)


(Reporting by Ben Klayman in Detroit; Editing by David Gregorio)
